DataElement.preferredName: Neoplasm Staging Performed Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the malignant testicular germ cell tumor stage.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation.  Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._The process of defining at what point in the natural history of a malignant disease a patient is when a diagnosis is made._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
The process of defining at what point in the natural history of a malignant disease a patient is when a diagnosis is made.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004_Any distinct time period in a sequence of events.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: the cancer involves the testis and metastasus beyond the retroperitoneal and paraaortic lymph nodes
cancer involved the testis and metastasis to retroperitoneal / paraaortic lymph nodes
cancer remains localized to the testis

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Stage
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004:Any distinct time period in a sequence of events.

Concepts.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the testis. It predominantly affects young men. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.
Any distinct time period in a sequence of events.
